A 30-year-old man presented with a history of transient loss of consciousness and palpitation. His ECG showed ventricular tachycardia. Which one of the following treatments should be avoided?
Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of scopolamine?
questions.correct_answer: C. Reversible antagonist at muscarinic receptors
questions.explanation:
References:

  • ↳ Sol:
  • ↳ • Commonly known as antimuscarinics, these agents (for example, atropine and scopolamine) block muscarinic receptors causing inhibition of all muscarinic functions. In addition, these drugs block the few exceptional sympathetic neurons that are cholinergic, such as those innervating salivary and sweat glands. • In contrast to the cholinergic agonists, which have limited usefulness therapeutically, the cholinergic blockers are beneficial in a variety of clinical situations. • Because they do not block nicotinic receptors, the antimuscarinic drugs have little or no action at skeletal neuromuscular junctions or autonomic ganglia. [Note: A number of antihistaminic and antidepressant drugs also have antimuscarinic activity.

A 5-year child presents with progressive weakness. The following make a diagnosis of Guillain-Barre syndrome more likely:

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of over 50 lymphocytes/ml in the cerebrospinal fluid.

options.label: D
options.text: Asymmetric weakness of the lower limbs.

questions.text: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinaemia is typical of:

A 15-year-old girl is presents with sudden deterioration of school performance. Over the past month, her mother noticed an occasional paint stain on the girl's hands. Her mother noticed six bottles of typewriter correction fluid in her bedroom. Which of the following is the most likely consequence of chronic inhalant abuse?
All of the following statements concerning the risk of vaccine-associated paralytic poliomyelitis (VAPP) are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: The risk is associated only with OPV and not IPV

options.label: B
options.text: The risk is higher after the second and third doses than after the first dose

options.label: C
options.text: The risk is higher for immunocompromised persons

options.label: D
options.text: The risk is present for household contacts as well as vaccinees

questions.correct_answer: B. The risk is higher after the second and third doses than after the first dose

questions.text: All of the following are contraindications to varicella vaccine except:

options.label: A
options.text: Past history of chickenpox, according to the mother

options.label: B
options.text: Her younger sibling currently has chickenpox

options.label: C
options.text: She currently has an upper respiratory tract infection with temperature of 100°F

options.label: D
options.text: Administration of MMR vaccine 2 wk ago

questions.correct_answer: D. Administration of MMR vaccine 2 wk ago

questions.text: A 22-year-old male patient has been brought to OPD by his family members with history of loosening of clothes at inappropriate places. There are several times when he laughs inappropriately during the interview. His speech is confusing and unpredictably shifts from one topic to another. There is also history of mirror gazing and giggling to self. What is the most likely diagnosis:
All are true about "atypical depression" except:

options.label: D
options.text: More frequent comorbid diagnosis of panic disorder as compared to with typical major depressive disorder

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman delivers a healthy baby boy by Caesarean section. She notes over the next week that she has become irritable and is not sleeping very well. She worries that her child will die and fantasizes that if the child died, she would kill herself as well. She reports not being able to sleep, and has lost weight. Over the course of the following week, she begins to investigate how she might commit suicide and calls a friend to see whether the friend will babysit so that the woman will not be leaving the child alone should this occur. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 32-year-old man is started on Lithium after being diagnosed with bipolar disorder. His psychiatrist explains the risks and benefits of the drug and tells the patient that the drug can affect several organs in the body and he will need blood tests every 6 months. Which of the following labs should be drawn that often on this patient?

A patient with complaints of having a deformed nose. He has visited several plastic surgeons but they have assured that there is nothing wrong with his nose. In spite of these reassurances, he continues to believe that his nose is deformed, He also complains that nobody takes him seriously because of the deformity of his nose, and he is extremely embarrassed because of this. he is most probably suffering from:
All of the following are true about pancreatic pseudocyst except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a collection of amylase rich fluid

options.label: B
options.text: Develops within 2 weeks after the onset of acute pancreatitis

options.label: C
options.text: Pseudocyst fluid has a low CEA level

questions.correct_answer: B. Develops within 2 weeks after the onset of acute pancreatitis

questions.text: Which of the following is not an intramural cause of intestinal obstruction?

options.label: B

questions.text: Steriotactic core needle biopsy of mammographic calcification demonstrates sclerosing adenosis associated with the calcification and LCIS not associated with calcifications (an incidental finding). The patient should be treated by?

options.label: B
options.text: Re-excisionto negative margin followed by whole breast irradiation.

options.label: C
options.text: Re-excision to negative margin, sentinel node biopsy and whole breast irradiation.

options.label: D
options.text: Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.correct_answer: D. Close surveillance including annual mammography and biannual clinical breast examination.

questions.text: Auxillary orthotopic liver transplant is indicated for :

options.label: D
options.text: Acute fulminant liver failure for any cause

questions.correct_answer: D. Acute fulminant liver failure for any cause

The surgeon decides to perform the left adrenalectomy via a posterior approach. In the process of making a deep posterior incision along the 12th rib, the surgeon notes that the blood seeping into the operative field has changed from bright red to dark, which indicates :

options.label: A
options.text: That the costo-diaphragmatic recess has been entered

options.label: B
options.text: That the liver has been incised

options.label: C
options.text: That the peritoneal cavity has been opened

options.label: D
options.text: That the renal capsule has been punctured

questions.correct_answer: A. That the costo-diaphragmatic recess has been entered

questions.text: Components of “Littre’s hernia” include :
Which of the following statement is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Large hernias are always more dangerous than small

options.label: C
options.text: Femoral hernias should always be repaired

options.label: D
options.text: Indirect hernias are more common in elderly

questions.correct_answer: C. Femoral hernias should always be repaired

questions.text: A 60 year old females presented with hematuria and diagnosed transitional cell carcinoma of bladder stage T1. N1 M0. Best treatment modalities is

options.label: B
options.text: Transurethral resection and intra vesical chemo-immunotheraphy

options.label: C
options.text: Total cystectomy and pelvic lymphaden ectomy

questions.correct_answer: B. Transurethral resection and intra vesical chemo-immunotheraphy

questions.text: Vessels at high risk during the costoxiphoid approach include :
questions.correct_answer: B. The left internal thoracic artery

questions.text: A patient is diagnosed as having intestinal angina (thrombotic occlusion of the superior mesenteric artery near its origin). If significant collateral circulation is not present or fails to develop, all the following parts of the intestinal tract may become gangrenous except the:

questions.text: Within the femoral triangle, the femoral vein and artery are encased in a fascial femoral sheath. options.label: C
options.text: Bleeding > 200 ml/hour for 3 or more hours

questions.text: The TRAM (transverse rectus abdominis musculocutaneous) flap has revolutionized breast reconstruction. All of the following can be considered advantages and indications of the free TRAM flap over pedicled TRAM except which one of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced abdominal dissection and muscle sacrifice.

options.label: B
options.text: History of heavy cigarette use (10 packs/ years smoking)

options.label: D
options.text: Avoidance of disturbance of medial inframammary fold

questions.correct_answer: C. High incidence of flap failure

A 22-yrs-old woman, G2P1, at 20 weeks of gestation, presents with acute-onset lower abdominal pain. She has a history of fibroids and an unknown abdominal surgery. Her vital signs are as follows: T = 99.2, BP = 105/68, P= 110, R = 28. Abdomen is nontender except for spot tenderness in the midline, between the umbilicus and the symphysis pubis. There is no rebound tenderness or guarding. There is no costovertebral angle tenderness. Her fundus is 28 cm above the symphysis pubis. Her white blood cells are elevated, urinalysis is normal, and her liver function tests are within normal range. The most likely diagnosis is:
Best parameter for ultrasound evaluation of IUGR is :
Teenage pregnancy is associated with all expect.
The prerequisites for external cephalic version rotation of the head are all expect:
questions.correct_answer: C. Favourable shape of the pelvis

options.label: B
options.text: A 28-year-old patient with cyclic pelvic pain and who has a mother and a sister with endometriosis

options.label: C
options.text: A 25-year-old female with a history of dyspareunia, painful nodular masses in the rectovaginal septum, and a left adnexal mass

questions.text: True statements regarding postpartum depression include which of the following?

questions.correct_answer: D. About 10 to 12% of women develop postpartum depression
